instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
This mac has suffered oxidation on the SMC and <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. 
Chime, activity on USB, but no image, only on external video.
 I used a good display.

<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: What is the working current of the motherboardï¼Ÿ

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Do you get 3V at pins 18/19 of J8300 in the first few seconds, when chime?
If yes, pin 14 should go high at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Check for pulse there without internal LCD connected.
If not present, check if <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> pulses at the mentioned time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
''  If not present, check if <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> pulses at the mentioned time.  '' 
0V, no pulse when mac has the chime.
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> 0v, no pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Did you try without LCD connected?
Check directly when turns on, before the chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
No display connected <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> 652mV pulse.
mode diode 0,631V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message: I tested another BIOS file with a clean ME region, but no result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Looks like PCH problem.
Inspect for other corroded components.
Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH/CPU; heat it as usual.
